intro: Hesperis inodora var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces white or pale yellow flowers in early summer. Its foliage is often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
